alert.note: Alert for Mobile; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 3:39PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama and southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, in southwest Alabama, Mobile and Washington. In southeast Mississippi, Greene. * WHEN...Until 645 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 339 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Leakesville, Deer Park, Dueitt, Rounsaville, Pisgah, Walley, Clark, Jonathan, Hillman, Burbank, Bradley, Escatawpa, Vinegar Bend, Four Point, Byrd, Neely, Avera, Bothwell, Dwight and Sidney.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
